data.title: "Authentic"
data.text: As Dick Van Dyke's Mockney accent in "Mary Poppins." Still there's an OK array of beer, plenty of footie on TV and some decent British pub food. To be honest Thousand Oaks isn't swamped with half-decent watering holes and the Crown & Anchor is one of the better ones - not that it's a particular high bar.

data.title: My Favorite Revitalized Pub in Town
data.text:
I like pubs.  The whole idea of friends and family gathering for a meal, a drink, conversation and catching a game or two.  In the past I've always occasioned Crown & Anchor for their fish and chips and a draught.  It's one of the few local places that practices a Guinness  two-part pour (or pull...).  Food has always been good (not always great...), with a nice lively setting in the bar for every match/game that patrons want to watch, with a more subdued booth and table dining area for families and older folks out the main area, and an entry courtyard that is sometimes home to live music.

Last year Crown & Anchor expanded the bar, and it's a whole different version of the place only better.  It's cleaner, more alive, food's improved to very good to sometimes great (fresher, more variety, and just plain better), and service is friendlier with more personality.  The larger bar and seating area, the darts and entertainment stage, all make it a more interesting and fun place to be.  I'm going there twice as often for a business lunch, or with friends and family for dinner.  Great to see we have a nice local Pub to count on.

data.title: British Food At Its Best
data.text:
Six of us visited on a busy Saturday morning where live football was on one of the many TVs that this establishment has, between us we had the curry half rice and chips, bangers and mash and I had the fish and chips.

The waitress Nicola was very patient with my questions concerning what type of fish and how fresh it was, she assured me I would definently enjoy and she was spot on crispy batter lovely white cod and delicious home made chips.
The others in the party said there food was also of a high standard, also decent beer selection and good selection of vodkas and whiskey,s 
A good atmosphere in this bar helped out by the friendliness, attentiveness and professionalism of the waitress Nicola.

data.title: Best place to watch soccer
data.text: While I've been here for lunch, it doesn't even hold a candle to the times I've been here for a soccer or rugby game.  That's when the place just lights up, and you'll hear whoops of joy, and screams of sorrow (often drowned in a pint of the finest brews out there).  This is a really fun place to go with your work colleagues, friends, and maybe even a date that enjoys sports.

data.title: So good we came back twice!
data.text:
My wife was craving a Sunday roast and the crown & anchor seemed to be the only place with Yorkshire pud on the menu for miles.

We have visited many so called British pubs whilst on holiday in the us to get our fix and always enter with trepidation - some are absolute dives in really rough areas (Phoenix ...) and we walk straight out, others just try too hard and are just like a bad British pub!

The crown & anchor has to be one of the best, great authentic food and really friendly 
staff. My namesake Trevor gets a special mention here. 

Yes, the carpets in the restaurant are authentic British pub circa 1975 but it gets 5* for doing exactly what it is supposed to do without any fuss or pretentions - and serving up authentic Yorkshire puds, Cornish pasties and fish and chips!

data.title: Atmosphere dingy
data.text: Atmosphere could use and update. Food is decent and prices are reasonable.  With a little clean up and refresh of the  inside, this could be a nice place.

data.title: Awesome place to watch Football!  :D
data.text:
We enjoy coming here from time to time to watch the big matches and are never disappointed with the food, beer, or crowd!  They open early during the EPL season, as well.

They've recently remodeled and it's even better than before!  

We love their breakfasts and they are consistent with cooking the food how we order our eggs - always done perfectly!  Their fish and chips are delicious!

data.title: Fun, Food & Fare!
data.text: We like this place! The food's always good & the brews are plenty! Always know what to expect and never disappointed!

data.title: Authentic English Food!
data.text: On my first night in the area we went to this Pub/resturant as my friend wanted me to taste English Fish and Chips in California...  I was pleasantly surprised they were real chips and not fries... the new waitress was very good at following up our questions regarding the type of fish and any other questions we had.. We had a fish and chip basket and sticky toffee pudding... I also made suggestions about the desert we had and she agreed and went to enquire.. I would go back and take my american  friends to have real British food.. We also own a fish n chip  shop in New Zealand .. S*

data.title: Best place in town for a pint
data.text: Actually a nice restaurant for British style pub grub.  Scotch Eggs are authentic, serve a mean Fish and Chips, choice of sausages and the Curry Chicken is very good.  The coating on the fish is uniform, crisp on the outside, not so greasy on the inside and the fish itself is cooked through and flaky. Can be a little tight in the bar, but they have nice seating on the patio under a big oak.   Only one dart board.  Best place in town for a pint.

data.title: Love the Breakfast!
data.text: I love the British breakfast of eggs, beans and sausage! For Lunch or Dinner try the Fish and Chips and they have live music on the weekend evenings as well! It's Jolly good!

data.title: Great venue if you are a soccer fanatic.
data.text: Have had dinner and lunch here more than once.  The fare includes English dishes, but has considerable California fare.  The beer list is extensive, which includes my favorite - Smithwick's.  A lunchtime crowd watched a soccer match between Liverpool and Dortmund.  When Liverpool scored, the roar of the crowd was enough to lift the roof off the place.  On summer Friday evenings, a band often plays in the courtyard.  All-in-all, a very friendly place.

data.title: Saturday night Surprise first visit
data.text: My husband and came to this pub on a Saturday night on a whim. It was not very crowded in the dining area so we got in right away. The fish sandwich was good and had coleslaw that didn't have too much sugar in it. The fish was grilled so no caloric breading to deal with. Has traditional British decor and comfortable booths. We will return.

data.title: what to eat
data.text: Their food is great but we like to get the poo poo platter and share it and drink. It's loud like it should be ,Being a pub and all Lots of guy's and more drinking.

data.title: Bouncers
data.text: Have not visited this "Pub" since they started two bouncers on duty. Obviously don't feel comfortable.

data.title: Much better then Usual Pub Fare
data.text:
I've been here for lunch twice and enjoyed it both times. The menu is large and everything we ate was good. The homemade beef barley soup was terrific and tasty.
The cod was prepared and presented perfectly. The Cobb salad was very good.

The bar area was busy even on a Monday for lunch. However, we sat in a quiet corner in the dining room. There are TV's for all the sports games. So there is really something for everyone.

data.title: Great fish and Chips
data.text: The fish and chips were good and the service was terrific. This is a family friendly place but also has a bar where you can eat and relax.

data.title: FRIENDLY PLACE
data.text:
They just recently expanded the bar into the next door empty space.  Also added several TV's.  There is now a
stage in the new section. One recent Saturday night they had live karaoke with two musicians.  The stage also is
for their live bands.  The dining room is a good size.  They hold Trivia in the dining room on Monday nights.
It's what I would call a Neighborhood Bar with their Loyal patrons.
  I like that they have Heineken on draft.  They have a 
Happy Hour also with good prices on beer.
There are lots of different items on the Menu. It's an Irish pub with your typical Irish Fish and Chips.
My opinion of the food is Fair although I have had things that were not good.  So if you're looking for a friendly pub and not so great food, then try it.

data.title: Great local bar
data.text: This is a pretty busy place filled with fun people without being overly crowded. It has a nice mixture of younger and middle aged people. Jeff (bartender) is fantastic and knowledgeable of the area for recommendations.

data.title: Back to the British Countryside without the airfare
data.text:
We had recorded Downton Abbey and before watching it we got in the mood by visiting the Crown and Anchor. My feeling was for one of the Pies that pubs do so well and a pint. well it did not disappoint. I had a Newcastle Ale and a chicken and vege pie and after a soup my wife had the same. 
The ambiance was fun; the sounds of clinking glasses and pitchers very social and the accents took us across the pond. there are many screens around both the bar and the restaurant as it is a sports environment.
As with most country pubs the food is filling and satisfying. Lots of Brit draft on tap.
We will go back...got to try the banger breakfast.
